title: unexpected panic while compiling paru on archlinux ARM aarch64

labels.name: I-ICE
labels.description: Issue: The compiler panicked, giving an Internal Compilation Error (ICE) ❄️

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

body:
while using `makepkg` and rustc 1.57.0 on archlinux ARM on rpi3 (armv8/aarch64), one gets:

```
   Compiling paru v1.9.2 (/home/cassini/asp/paru/src/paru-1.9.2)
thread 'rustc' panicked at 'called `Result::unwrap()` on an `Err` value: "invalid enum variant tag while decoding `ExpnKind`, expected 0..5"', compiler/rustc_metadata/src/rmeta/decoder.rs:265:29
note: run with `RUST_BACKTRACE=1` environment variable to display a backtrace

error: internal compiler error: unexpected panic

note: the compiler unexpectedly panicked. this is a bug.

note: we would appreciate a bug report: https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/issues/new?labels=C-bug%2C+I-ICE%2C+T-compiler&template=ice.md

note: rustc 1.57.0 (Arch Linux rust 1:1.57.0-1) running on aarch64-unknown-linux-gnu

note: compiler flags: -C opt-level=3 -C lto=off -C embed-bitcode=no -C codegen-units=1 --crate-type lib

note: some of the compiler flags provided by cargo are hidden

query stack during panic:
#0 [explicit_item_bounds] finding item bounds for `hyper::body::to_bytes::to_bytes::{opaque#0}`
#1 [item_bounds] elaborating item bounds for `hyper::body::to_bytes::to_bytes::{opaque#0}`
end of query stack
error: could not compile `paru`
warning: build failed, waiting for other jobs to finish...
error: build failed
==> ERREUR : Une erreur s’est produite dans build().
    Abandon…
```

I just discovered there is prebuild binary package so I will not try to make it work.
